title: Plan 3: B2B Marketing Masterplan (For any niche — scalable from startup to enterprise)
intro: A complete B2B plan covering Planning and Execution. Use with your CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce, Ledge) and ABM stack.

stages.title: STAGE 1 — PLANNING (Build the blueprint before spending)
stages.description: Define ICPs, personas, offers, channels, tech, and budgets before launching campaigns.

steps.title: 1) Market & Audience Research (ICP, Personas, JTBD, Segmentation)
steps.goal: Define your Ideal Customer Profiles (ICPs), decision-maker personas, buying committees, and the jobs-to-be-done your solution fulfills.
how: If you already have CRM data: Pull closed-won vs. closed-lost opportunities from HubSpot, Salesforce, Ledge.
Segment by industry, company size, ACV, buying timeline, and lead source; analyze win/loss reasons and high-LTV attributes.
If starting fresh: Build a Target Account List (TAL) with LinkedIn Sales Navigator by industry, company size, region, revenue, decision-maker titles; export CSV for outreach.
Use intent data: Free (Google Alerts, G2 category keyword alerts, LinkedIn keyword search); Paid (Bombora, ZoomInfo Intent, 6sense, Slintel).
Competitive customer mining: Identify competitor clients via case studies, G2 reviews, LinkedIn employee matches and add to TAL.
Primary research: Run surveys (Typeform, SurveyMonkey) to ICP audiences via LinkedIn Ads; conduct 5–10 buyer interviews on pains, triggers, decision processes.
Enrich contact data with Apollo.io, Hunter.io, Lusha, LeadIQ for verified emails and phones.
Build Personas & Segments: ICP (industry, revenue, employee count, tech stack, location); Personas (CEO, CTO, CMO, CFO, Procurement) with goals, KPIs, objections, channels.
Map personas to funnel stages and to targeting in LinkedIn, Google, and ABM tools.
deliverables: Target account list uploaded to CRM

steps.title: 2) Competitive & Channel Gap Analysis
steps.goal: Find opportunities across SEO, content, paid, ABM, and partnerships.
how: Identify 5–10 direct and indirect competitors.
SEO gap: keyword coverage, technical SEO quality, content depth.
Content gap: missing formats like webinars, case studies, ROI calculators.
Paid gap: ad copy angles, keyword targeting, LinkedIn ad presence.
Event gap: industry trade shows, webinars, sponsorships competitors attend.
Channel priority scoring: rate channels 1–5 for audience fit, cost, intent, scalability.

steps.title: 3) Brand & Messaging System
steps.goal: Codify positioning, tone, and visual identity for consistent outreach.
how: Positioning statement: “For [ICP], [Brand] is the [category] that [benefit], because [proof].”
Messaging House: UVP, 3–5 key benefits, supporting proof points.
Tone & Voice: Define 5 adjectives and examples for each.
Visual Identity: Logo, colors, fonts, imagery style.
Templates: Sales decks, case studies, webinar slides, ad creative frames.

steps.title: 4) Funnel & Channel Strategy
steps.goal: Match channels to funnel stages (Awareness → Consideration → Decision → Expansion).
how: Map funnel stages to KPIs: Awareness (Reach, Engagement, CTR), Consideration (MQLs, webinar signups, whitepaper downloads), Decision (SQLs, demo requests, proposals), Expansion (upsell revenue, referrals).

Assign channels per stage: Awareness (LinkedIn Ads, thought leadership, PR, industry reports); Consideration (SEO, retargeting, ABM sequences, webinars); Decision (case studies, ROI tools, free trials, sales enablement); Expansion (customer marketing, advocacy, ABM upsell).
Budget split: 70% proven channels, 20% optimization, 10% experimental.

steps.title: 5) Offers, Pricing & Conversion Readiness
steps.goal: Craft B2B-specific offers that drive action and ensure the site converts.
how: Core offers: free trial, ROI assessment, consultation, pilot project, proof of concept.
CRO: fast site, concise forms (≤5 fields), clear CTA, social proof (logos, testimonials, case studies).
Risk reversal: guarantees, opt-out clauses, references.

steps.title: 6) Tech Stack, Tracking & Governance
steps.goal: Get CRM, analytics, and attribution ready before launch.
how: CRM setup: pipeline stages, lead scoring, lifecycle definitions in HubSpot/Salesforce/Ledge.
Tracking: GTM, GA4, ad platform pixels, LinkedIn Insight Tag.
Attribution: start with first/last touch; evolve to multi-touch with Bizible or Dreamdata.
Governance: UTM standards, naming conventions, data owner assignment.

steps.title: 7) Budgeting & Forecasting
steps.goal: Allocate spend and predict pipeline outcomes.
how: Top-down: % of target revenue (B2B: 5–10%).
Bottom-up: CPC, CTR, CVR → CPL → CAC → ROI.
Stage rollout: Pilot (month 1–2) → Optimize (month 3–4) → Scale (month 5+).

stages.title: STAGE 2 — EXECUTION (Run the work)
stages.description: Launch and scale across SEO, paid, social, nurture, ABM, and events, while optimizing conversion.

steps.title: 8) SEO (Technical, Content, Authority)
steps.goal: Capture high-intent B2B demand and build authority.
how: Audit with Screaming Frog or Sitebulb.
Keyword research focused on pain points & industry terms.
Create pillar pages, whitepapers, case studies, solution briefs.
Internal linking between thought leadership and product pages.
Link building via guest posts, podcast appearances, industry PR.

steps.title: 9) Paid Search & Display
steps.goal: Drive qualified traffic and pipeline from high-intent queries and retargeting.
how: Structure campaigns by intent: brand, competitor, high-intent non-brand.
Use LinkedIn retargeting with display/YouTube for consideration.
Maintain negative keyword lists to block unqualified clicks.

steps.title: 10) Paid Social (LinkedIn, Meta, Twitter/X)
steps.goal: Reach decision-makers and influence buying committees.
how: LinkedIn: target by role, industry, company size; use Conversation Ads, Document Ads, and carousels for thought leadership.
Meta: broad retargeting and lookalikes from CRM uploads.

steps.title: 11) Email & Nurture
steps.goal: Educate and progress leads through the funnel.
how: Segment by funnel stage in CRM.
Build flows: welcome, lead nurture, reactivation, upsell.
Content: case studies, webinar invites, ROI tools.

steps.title: 12) ABM (Account-Based Marketing)
steps.goal: Coordinate 1:1 and 1:few outreach across ads, email, and sales.
how: Upload TAL to LinkedIn Ads and run personalized creative.
Coordinate marketing emails with sales outreach in HubSpot/Salesforce sequences.
Send custom landing pages per account segment.

steps.title: 13) Events & Webinars
steps.goal: Generate MQLs and accelerate deals with live education.
how: Host monthly educational webinars.
Sponsor or attend 2–3 industry events per quarter.
Collect leads, enter into CRM, start nurture sequences.

steps.title: 14) CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization)
steps.goal: Increase demo and lead form conversions.
how: Use heatmaps, form analytics, and user testing for demo/lead forms.
A/B test form length, CTA wording, and social proof placement.
